column2: WASHINGTON DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. If you miss your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit, get back on the freeway in the opposite direction and return to the exit you want.
column6: signal other drivers to stop so you can turn.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 2. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 3. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column6: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 4. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column8: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column10: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 5. Which of the following is true about the Anti-Locking Brake System?
column6: It prevents skidding.
column8: It allows drivers to steer during an emergency braking situation.

column2: 6. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
column10: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.

column2: 7. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
column6: Warning signs
column8: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 8. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait for the next green light.
column6: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.

column2: 9. A good indication that it is safe to return to the right lane after passing a vehicle is when the vehicle that was passed:
column6: is on your left.
column8: is not visible in the rearview mirror.
column10: is visible in the rearview mirror.

column2: 10. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column6: maximum speed
column8: minimum speed

column2: 11. A yellow arrow means:
column4: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.

column2: 12. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 13. When you approach this sign, you must:
column6: stop if necessary.
column8: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 14. A first conviction for driving under the influence of alcohol or any drug can result in a license suspension for at least:
column6: 2 years.
column8: 30 days.

column2: 15. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column6: signal the train to stop.
column8: cross the tracks.
column10: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a side road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 17. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column2: 18. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the right.
column6: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 19. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 20. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Diamond
column8: Edge line

column2: 21. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column6: protect
column8: work with

column2: 22. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column6: you cannot pass.
column8: you cannot change lanes.

column2: 23. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column6: Red light
column8: Police officer

column2: 24. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column6: drive much faster
column8: accelerate much faster

column2: 25. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: Near school zones.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 26. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column4: You should look over your shoulder instead.
column6: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column8: Mirrors are useless.

column2: 27. Your BAC depends on:
column6: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 28. When entering traffic from a private driveway:
column4: you have the right-of-way over other vehicles.
column6: wait for the flagger to stop the traffic on the main road.
column8: always wait for the traffic light to turn green.
column10: yield to all vehicles on the main road.

column2: 29. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: increase your speed and move to the left.
column10: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.

column2: 30. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column4: slow down or move over safely.
column6: distance yourself from the situation.
column8: avoid making eye contact.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column6: Side Road
column8: Flagger ahead

column2: 32. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column6: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 33. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: pass slower vehicles on the right.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.

column2: 34. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: closetailing.
column8: tailgating.

column2: 35. What does a flashing red light mean?
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.
column8: Drivers may move forward with caution.

column2: 36. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column8: Replacing worn wiper blades.
column10: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 37. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Return gestures and shouts.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 38. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column6: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column8: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.
column10: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.

column2: 39. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column6: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.

column2: 40. Braking distance is:
column4: how far a vehicle will travel, in ideal conditions, while the driver is braking.
column6: the total distance a vehicle has traveled until it comes to a complete stop.
column8: between 100 and 200 feet.
column10: how far a vehicle will continue to travel before the driver hits the brakes.
